record.title: MEASURES READ THE FIRST TIME--S. 2198 AND S. 2205
record.narrative:
MEASURES READ THE FIRST TIME--S. 2198 AND S. 2205 -- (Senate - October 18, 2007)

[Page: S13135]

speaking.paragraph: I understand there are two bills at the desk. I ask for their first reading, en bloc.

record.chair: The clerk will report the bills by title for the first time.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
A bill (S. 2198) to require the Architect of the Capitol to permit the acknowledgment of God on flag certificates.

A bill (S. 2205) to authorize the cancellation of removal and adjustment of status of certain alien students who are long-term United States residents and who entered the United States as children, and for other purposes.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask for their second reading and object to my own request.

record.chair: Objection is heard. The bills will be read a second time on the next legislative day.
